issue.body:
This reverts commit e37bf18e2b5291cd0620fb92264acfdf225e5a1b, added in #14784.

# Objective

The PR was fine, but the work was very poorly motivated and the resulting API is not actually very nice. The actual user need is likely better addressed by #14825.

## Solution

Revert the offending PR.

issue.title: makes toggling visibility easier

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
# Objective

Make toggling visibility easier

## Solution

Implement `Not` for `Visibility`, added methods `toggle()` and `toggle_inherited()`

## Testing

ran 
- `cargo run -p ci -- lints`
-  `cargo run -p ci -- test`
-  `cargo run -p ci -- compile`

body:
Beating a dead issue, but additionally, the default value of `Visibility` is `Inherited`.

But there's no reasonable one-size-fits-all behavior for toggling or negating `Inherited`, so by default this can't do anything. That seems potentially very confusing. The thing I personally find myself doing most is toggling between `Inherited` and `Hidden`, but this is going to be situational.

Maybe a set of well named convenience methods could work. But even then, where do we draw the line? There are many possible desirable behaviors.

```rust
toggle_inherited_visible()
toggle_inherited_hidden()
toggle_visible_hidden()

// But what do we want to do when that third variant is encountered?
// (just for illustration. not proposing adding a bunch of functions like this.)
toggle_visible_hidden_inherited_is_ignored() // potentially confusing. this is a no-op with default Visibility.
toggle_visible_hidden_inherited_is_visible() // neither of these two are obviously correct
toggle_visible_hidden_inherited_is_hidden()
toggle_visible_hidden_inherited_panics() // this seems undesirable
```

Ignoring the third variant is probably the best we can do, and maybe it's not so bad if all three methods are implemented / documented.

For the record, I still lean towards not doing this at all.
Yeah, a full set of really clear convenience methods would be nice, but I'm not personally dying for it. Inherited visibility makes this *way* more complex!
For the record, my preference is the `toggle_inherited_visible` naming. No panics though!

issue.title: Add helper methods on `Visibility`

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
Fixes #14825

Edit: After feedback, these are the updated methods:

- `toggle_inherited_visible(&mut self)`
    - Toggles between `Visibility::Inherited` and `Visibility::Visible`. If the value is `Visibility::Hidden`, it remains unaffected.
- `toggle_inherited_hidden(&mut self)`
    - Toggles between `Visibility::Inherited` and `Visibility::Hidden`. If the value is `Visibility::Visible`, it remains unaffected.
- `toggle_visible_hidden(&mut self)`
    - Toggles between `Visibility::Visible` and `Visibility::Hidden`. If the value is `Visibility::Inherited`, it remains unaffected.
